Title: Exemplar FSRU arrives at Finland’s Inkoo terminal
Description: The Exemplar has anchored in the Finnish port of Inkoo ahead of its commissioning in mid-January. The floating storage and regasification unit is crucial to Finland and the Baltics’ security of supply as the region has historically heavily relied on Russian pipeline supplies.
Author: DE

Title: RWE signs 15-year LNG supply deal from Sempra’s Port Arthur project
Description: Germany’s RWE has agreed to buy 2.25 mtpa on a free-on-board basis from Sempra’s 13.5 mtpa Port Arthur project in Texas. This deal moves the US producer closer to reaching a final investment decision on the project next quarter and increases Germany’s security of supply as it pivots away from Russian pipeline gas.
Author: DE

Title: Oman LNG signs 3 term contracts with Japanese buyers
Description: Oman LNG has signed contracts totalling 2.35 mtpa with three Japanese buyers, Itochu, Jera, and Mitsui, forming the cornerstone for Oman LNG’s supply plans for 2024 onwards.
Author: CK

Title: ENN increases its offtake from NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG project
Description: Chinese energy firm ENN increased its offtake from NextDecade’s 27 mtpa Texas-based Rio Grande LNG project to 2 mtpa. All the volumes are indexed to the US Henry Hub natural gas price and will be supplied on a free-on-board basis.
Author: DE
